definition: full details/full particulars
to look over carefully/to scrutinize
old variant of 端[duan1]/start/origin
end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular
detailed/comprehensive

sentences.english: I gave the strange man the double-O.
sentences.chinese: 我仔细端详了这位陌生人。

sentences.english: As she placed one in her left eye she halted and stared into the mirror intently.
sentences.chinese: 她左眼戴上隐形眼镜，对着镜子仔细地端详。

sentences.english: By the dim light, you study his kind and fatherly face.
sentences.chinese: 透过暗光，你端详他友好如父的脸庞。

sentences.english: Watching her, I pondered doing something uplifting with the rest of the day.
sentences.chinese: 我端详着她，开始琢磨在今天剩下的时间里做些什么。

sentences.english: Just look at the cover of your book.
sentences.chinese: 只要端详一下你书上的封面。

sentences.english: He gave her a critical and condescending look-over.
sentences.chinese: 他用迁就的眼光细细地端详了她一下。

sentences.english: He pushes me out of the water and examines my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他把我从喷头下推开，然后端详着我的眼睛。

sentences.english: She gazes down at the man lying naked in her bed.
sentences.chinese: 她向下端详着在她的床上躺着的赤裸的男人。

sentences.english: Portia looked at Bassanio's face and was sure that something terrible had happened.
sentences.chinese: 波西亚端详着巴塞尼奥的脸，确信有重大事情发生。

sentences.english: He found himself looking at the young bucks at the bath.
sentences.chinese: 他发现他常常在端详浴场上的那些花花公子。

sentences.english: Ivetta fell silent, arched her neck, and studied him.
sentences.chinese: 艾薇塔陷入了沉默，向后仰起脖子，端详着他。

sentences.english: Look at the palms of your hands.
Marilla watched the happy young face.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽拉端详着安妮年轻快乐的脸。

sentences.english: She leaned forward to scrutinize their faces.
sentences.chinese: 她探身向前，端详他们的面容。

sentences.english: The tiny gnome peered over the railing into the secluded Dalaran courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 娇小的侏儒透过栏杆端详着魔法罩下的达拉然。

sentences.english: The owner of the antique mansion and designer Zhang Lianzhi are observing a antique vase.
sentences.chinese: 古瓷楼的主人兼设计者张连志在端详一个古瓷瓶。

definition: to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
(coll.) to remove (crinkles, dirt) with the palm of the hand
to stroke/to caress
to stroke/to caress
to approach/to lean close to
to peer/to scan/to examine carefully
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
to turn around in one's hands/to play with/to fiddle with
to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to gaze at/to stare fixedly at
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
half the day/a long time/quite a while
to weigh in the hand/to estimate
to stare at
old variant of 瞅[chou3]
(dialect) to look at
to rummage/to look through/to leaf through
